snippet: A 856-foot-wide channel formed by Hurricane Sandy in a New York barrier island has helped flush out the bay beyond, but residents blame it for increased flooding.
abstract: Local residents, scientists, environmentalists and government officials are debating whether to close 856 foot wide breach formed by Hurricane Sandy between ocean and Great South Bay on Fire Island; some residents say breach increases risk of flooding, while environmentalists say flowing ocean water is helping to clean out polluted bay.
lead_paragraph: A 856-foot-wide channel formed by Hurricane Sandy in a New York barrier island has helped flush out the bay beyond, but residents blame it for increased flooding.

headline.seo: At Fire Island, Officials Weigh Filling a Breach
headline.main: Breach Through Fire Island Also Divides Opinions
headline.print_headline: Breach Through Fire Island Also Divides Opinions
